Title: Hygrothermal Analysis of Laminated Composite Skew Conoids
Author(s): Ajay Kumar; Stanisław Fic; Danuta Barnat-Hunek; Barbara Sadowska-Buraczewska
Keywords: hygrothermal analysis; finite element; shell; laminated
Observation: Non-dimensional deflection increases with hl/hh ratio and decreases as skew angle or number of plies increases under hygrothermal load.

Title: The Impact of Moisture and Temperature on the Laminated Rhombic Hyperbolic Paraboloid
Author(s): Abhay Chaubey; Ajay Kumar; Małgorzata Grzegorczyk-Frańczak; Małgorzata Szafraniec
Keywords: temperature; moisture concentration; skew angle; laminated; ply orientation
Observation: Deflection decreases with increasing skew angle, increases with moisture concentration.

Title: Neural Network-Based Prediction Model…Skew Laminated Composite Sandwich Plates
Author(s): Vinayak Kallannavar; S. Kattimani; M.A. Mujtaba; Saad Alshahrani; M. I. M. Soudagar; Muhammad Imran
Keywords: artificial neural network; finite element; shear deformation; skew angle; sandwich plates
Observation: Increasing moisture or temperature lowers natural frequency; frequency increases with skew angle and aspect ratios.

Title: Buckling Analysis and Design Optimization of Trapezoidal Composite Plates under Hygrothermal Environments
Author(s): M.H. Yas; A. Bayat; S. Kamarian; A. Malekshahi; J.I. Song
Keywords: buckling; GDQ; genetic algorithm; hygrothermal; optimization
Observation: Hygrothermal humidity reduces stability; small moisture reduces critical buckling temperature.

Title: Free Vibration Analysis of a Spinning Composite Laminated Truncated Conical Shell under Hygrothermal Environment
Author(s): Xiao Li; Xuanling Zhang; Zhihong Zhou
Boundary Conditions: Fixed at small end (cantilevered); spinning motion
Keywords: hygrothermal; spinning; conical shell; free vibration; symmetric layup
Observation: Spin-induced Coriolis forces cause asymmetric frequency shifts; moisture & temperature strongly influence frequencies.

Title: Vibration Evolution of Laminated Composite Conical Shell with Arbitrary Foundation in Hygrothermal Environment
Author(s): Xuyuan Song; Chenguang Wang; Shuo Wang; Yewei Zhang
Keywords: arbitrary supports; experiment; hygrothermal; conical shell
Observation: Experiments show hygrothermal environment and support stiffness strongly affect vibration.
